Sacha Baron Cohen strikes again

“The Dictator” lacks the cultural tension of Cohen’s “Borat” and “Bruno,” and is a lazy satire that can’t bring itself to properly satirize anything.
Opinion | Juliette Kayyem

A crackdown avoided

In Mississippi, business interests thwart a harsh bill on illegal immigrants.

X marks the spot for merriment

SpeakEasy Stage Company’s enjoyably unhinged adaptation of the 1980 movie “Xanadu” is a feat of theatrical alchemy.

Some good ideas on health care

The House and the Senate have unveiled plans to contain the cost of health care in Mass. Now both chambers must compromise and scale back.

The Department of Veterans Affairs calls military sexual trauma "an epidemic," bringing a need for specialized care.
Dan Shaughnessy

Celtics give their all, Sox strike out

Fans are loving the gritty, hard-working Celtics this postseason, while the moody, underachieving Sox are generating enmity.
Opinion | Dr. Donald M. Berwick

In health care, cheaper can be better

Can the state's health care be universal, excellent, and far less expensive? Absolutely, writes the former head of the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.
